sect.title: Procedure Description
sect.p: This document details the procedure for installing a bicycle stem. It outlines preliminary requirements, the main procedure, and closing requirements.

sect.title: 2.2.4. Subsection: 2.4. Safety Precautions
sect.caution: Do not overtighten the stem bolt. Overtightening can damage the headset bearings.
The stem bolt does not secure the stem.
sect.note: Ensure the stem is aligned forward in line with the wheel.

sect.title: 2.2.5. Subsection: 2.5. Prerequisites
sect.p: Ensure the bicycle is securely mounted on a work stand with the front wheel free of the ground.

sect.title: 3.1. Step: Cleaning
sect.p: Remove all rust and corrosion using a clean dry cloth and rubbing alcohol.

sect.title: 3.2.1. Item: Lubrication
sect.p: Apply general lubricant to the following:

itemizedList.listItem: The threads of the stem and stem bolt.

sect.title: 3.2.2. Item: Installation
sect.p: Install the stem into the steerer tube.

sect.title: 3.2.3. Item: Alignment & Tightening
sect.p: Adjust the stem to align with the wheel. Firmly tighten the stem bolt.

sect.title: 3.3. Step: Handlebar Installation
sect.p: Install the handlebars (refer to document: S1000DBIKEAAA DA220000AA720A).
